intro: Tricoryne simplex, commonly known as the slender trichocline, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
